soil.name: Potting Soil
soil.description: Nutrient-rich soil suitable for all types of plants. Ideal for container gardening, it retains moisture and provides essential nutrients.
soil.benefits: Great for growing vegetables, herbs, and flowering plants.
soil.usage: Use it for potted plants or raised beds.
soil.tips: Mix with perlite or vermiculite for better drainage.
soil.careInstructions: Keep the soil moist but not soggy; check regularly.

soil.name: Organic Soil
soil.description: Natural soil, safe for plants and the environment. Contains no synthetic chemicals and is enriched with organic matter.
soil.benefits: Promotes healthy plant growth and improves soil structure.
soil.usage: Best for organic gardening practices.
soil.tips: Add compost regularly to enrich the soil.
soil.careInstructions: Avoid using chemical pesticides; maintain moisture.

soil.name: Cactus Soil
soil.description: Specially formulated soil for cactus and succulent plants. Drains quickly to prevent root rot.
soil.benefits: Prevents overwatering and encourages healthy growth.
soil.usage: Use for potted cacti and succulents.
soil.tips: Water sparingly; allow soil to dry out between waterings.
soil.careInstructions: Keep in bright light for best results.

soil.name: Seed Starting Mix
soil.description: Light and fluffy soil ideal for germinating seeds. Provides a perfect environment for seedling growth.
soil.benefits: Promotes strong root development and healthy seedlings.
soil.usage: Use for starting seeds indoors or outdoors.
soil.tips: Keep the mix moist but not waterlogged.
soil.careInstructions: Provide adequate light once seedlings emerge.

soil.name: Garden Soil
soil.description: Balanced soil suitable for most garden plants. Contains a mix of clay, sand, and organic matter.
soil.benefits: Supports a variety of flowers, vegetables, and shrubs.
soil.usage: Use for planting directly in garden beds.
soil.tips: Test soil pH for optimal plant growth.
soil.careInstructions: Regularly amend with organic matter.

soil.name: Compost Soil
soil.description: Rich, dark soil made from decomposed organic matter. Excellent for improving soil fertility.
soil.benefits: Enhances soil structure and moisture retention.
soil.usage: Mix into existing soil or use as top dressing.
soil.tips: Use homemade compost for best results.
soil.careInstructions: Keep moist and aerated to maintain microbial activity.

soil.name: Peat Moss
soil.description: Organic material harvested from peat bogs. Improves moisture retention and soil aeration.
soil.benefits: Lightens heavy soils and retains moisture.
soil.usage: Mix with soil or use in potting mixtures.
soil.tips: Wet before using to make it easier to work with.
soil.careInstructions: Store in a cool, dry place.

soil.name: Topsoil
soil.description: The uppermost layer of soil, rich in nutrients. Used for general gardening and landscaping.
soil.benefits: Improves soil quality and provides essential nutrients.
soil.usage: Use for leveling or as a base for planting.
soil.tips: Can be mixed with compost for added nutrients.
soil.careInstructions: Avoid compaction; keep loose for healthy root growth.

soil.name: Clay Soil
soil.description: Dense soil that retains water and nutrients well. Best for moisture-loving plants.
soil.benefits: Holds nutrients effectively but may drain poorly.
soil.usage: Use for plants that prefer moist conditions.
soil.tips: Mix with sand to improve drainage if necessary.
soil.careInstructions: Regularly check for waterlogged conditions.

soil.name: Sandy Soil
soil.description: Soil with large particles that drains quickly. Ideal for drought-tolerant plants.
soil.benefits: Prevents root rot but may require more frequent watering.
soil.usage: Best for plants that need well-drained conditions.
soil.tips: Mix with organic matter to improve moisture retention.
soil.careInstructions: Water regularly during dry spells.

soil.name: Bonsai Soil
soil.description: Specially formulated soil for bonsai trees. Provides excellent drainage and aeration.
soil.benefits: Helps maintain small root systems and prevents overwatering.
soil.usage: Use for potted bonsai trees.
soil.tips: Repot every couple of years to refresh soil.
soil.careInstructions: Keep soil slightly moist; do not let it dry out completely.

soil.name: Hydroponic Growing Medium
soil.description: Soil-less medium for hydroponic systems. Supports plant roots and retains moisture.
soil.benefits: Promotes faster growth rates and reduces soil-borne diseases.
soil.usage: Use in hydroponic setups.
soil.tips: Regularly check nutrient solution levels.
soil.careInstructions: Change nutrient solution every 2-3 weeks.

soil.name: Potting Mix
soil.description: Pre-mixed soil designed for container gardening. Contains organic matter, peat moss, and perlite.
soil.benefits: Lightweight and well-draining, ideal for most potted plants.
soil.usage: Use in pots and containers.
soil.tips: Choose a mix appropriate for your specific plants.
soil.careInstructions: Keep evenly moist, but not soggy.

soil.name: Mulch
soil.description: Organic material applied to the soil surface. Helps retain moisture and suppress weeds.
soil.benefits: Improves soil health as it breaks down.
soil.usage: Spread around plants in garden beds.
soil.tips: Replenish mulch layer as it decomposes.
soil.careInstructions: Keep mulch away from plant stems.

soil.name: Bark Mulch
soil.description: Natural mulch made from shredded tree bark. Excellent for moisture retention.
soil.benefits: Reduces weed growth and regulates soil temperature.
soil.usage: Use around trees and shrubs.
soil.tips: Choose hardwood bark for longer-lasting results.
soil.careInstructions: Reapply every year or two.

soil.name: Compost Blend
soil.description: A mixture of composted organic materials. Enriches soil with nutrients.
soil.benefits: Improves soil structure and fertility.
soil.usage: Mix into garden beds or potted plants.
soil.tips: Use well-aged compost for best results.
soil.careInstructions: Avoid over-applying to prevent nutrient burn.

soil.name: Perlite
soil.description: Lightweight volcanic rock used to improve soil aeration and drainage.
soil.benefits: Prevents soil compaction and enhances root growth.
soil.usage: Mix into potting soil or garden beds.
soil.tips: Do not use alone; combine with other soils.
soil.careInstructions: Keep dry before mixing with soil.

soil.name: Vermiculite
soil.description: Natural mineral that improves soil aeration and moisture retention.
soil.benefits: Helps seeds germinate and young plants establish roots.
soil.usage: Mix into potting soil or seed starting mixes.
soil.tips: Use in conjunction with peat or compost.
soil.careInstructions: Store in a dry place.

soil.name: Coir (Coconut Fiber)
soil.description: Natural fiber extracted from coconut husks. Retains moisture and promotes aeration.
soil.benefits: Sustainable alternative to peat moss.
soil.usage: Use in potting mixes or as a mulch.
soil.tips: Rehydrate coir before use.
soil.careInstructions: Keep moist, especially for seedlings.

soil.name: Gravel
soil.description: Small stones used for drainage in potted plants or garden beds.
soil.benefits: Prevents water from pooling and causing root rot.
soil.usage: Layer at the bottom of pots or mix into soil.
soil.tips: Use in heavy soils that retain too much moisture.
soil.careInstructions: Check for clogging in drainage holes.

fertilizers.name: Organic Fertilizer
fertilizers.description: Fertilizer made from plant waste, enhances soil nutrients. Contains a variety of micro and macronutrients.
fertilizers.benefits: Slow-release, improving soil health and plant growth over time.
fertilizers.usage: Apply every 4-6 weeks during the growing season.
fertilizers.tips: Use in combination with mulch for best results.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Water after application to activate the nutrients.

fertilizers.name: Chemical Fertilizer
fertilizers.description: Synthetic fertilizer, provides nutrients quickly to plants. Formulated to deliver specific nutrients like nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium.
fertilizers.benefits: Fast-acting and effective for immediate plant needs.
fertilizers.usage: Use as directed, usually every 6-8 weeks.
fertilizers.tips: Dilute as instructed to avoid burning plants.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Monitor plant health closely after application.

fertilizers.name: Fish Emulsion Fertilizer
fertilizers.description: Organic liquid fertilizer made from fish waste. Rich in nitrogen and trace minerals.
fertilizers.benefits: Encourages lush green growth and strong root development.
fertilizers.usage: Dilute with water and apply every 2-4 weeks.
fertilizers.tips: Use on all plants, especially during the growing season.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Store in a cool, dark place to maintain freshness.

fertilizers.name: Bone Meal Fertilizer
fertilizers.description: Organic fertilizer made from ground animal bones. Provides a slow-release source of phosphorus.
fertilizers.benefits: Supports root development and flowering.
fertilizers.usage: Apply during planting or as a side dressing.
fertilizers.tips: Mix into the soil for best results.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Keep away from pets as it may attract them.

fertilizers.name: Kelp Fertilizer
fertilizers.description: Liquid fertilizer derived from seaweed. Rich in micronutrients and growth hormones.
fertilizers.benefits: Stimulates plant growth and enhances disease resistance.
fertilizers.usage: Dilute and spray on plants every 2-4 weeks.
fertilizers.tips: Use in combination with other fertilizers for best results.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Store in a cool, dark place.

fertilizers.name: Slow-Release Granular Fertilizer
fertilizers.description: Granular fertilizer that releases nutrients slowly over time. Ideal for continuous feeding.
fertilizers.benefits: Reduces the risk of nutrient burn and provides steady nutrition.
fertilizers.usage: Apply every 8-12 weeks, depending on the formulation.
fertilizers.tips: Water well after application to activate the granules.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Keep in a dry place to prevent clumping.

fertilizers.name: Alfalfa Meal Fertilizer
fertilizers.description: Organic fertilizer made from alfalfa plants. Contains natural growth hormones.
fertilizers.benefits: Promotes vigorous plant growth and improves soil structure.
fertilizers.usage: Mix into soil before planting or as a side dressing.
fertilizers.tips: Use in moderation to avoid over-fertilizing.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Keep away from pets.

fertilizers.name: Sulfur Fertilizer
fertilizers.description: Elemental sulfur used to lower soil pH. Important for plants that thrive in acidic soils.
fertilizers.benefits: Improves nutrient uptake in acid-loving plants.
fertilizers.usage: Apply as needed based on soil pH testing.
fertilizers.tips: Mix thoroughly into the soil for even distribution.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Store in a dry place.

fertilizers.name: Wood Ash Fertilizer
fertilizers.description: Natural fertilizer made from burned wood. Rich in potassium and trace minerals.
fertilizers.benefits: Enhances soil fertility and can help control pests.
fertilizers.usage: Sprinkle on the soil surface or mix into the soil.
fertilizers.tips: Use sparingly, as too much can raise soil pH.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Keep in a dry place.

fertilizers.name: Compost Tea
fertilizers.description: Liquid fertilizer made by steeping compost in water. Rich in nutrients and beneficial microorganisms.
fertilizers.benefits: Boosts plant health and promotes microbial activity in soil.
fertilizers.usage: Dilute and apply as a foliar spray or soil drench.
fertilizers.tips: Use fresh compost for the best results.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Store in a cool, dark place and use within a week.

fertilizers.name: Seaweed Extract
fertilizers.description: Organic liquid fertilizer derived from seaweed. Rich in micronutrients.
fertilizers.benefits: Stimulates plant growth and improves resistance to pests.
fertilizers.usage: Dilute and spray on plants every 2-4 weeks.
fertilizers.tips: Use as a foliar feed for quick nutrient uptake.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Store in a cool, dark place.

fertilizers.name: Bat Guano Fertilizer
fertilizers.description: Organic fertilizer made from bat droppings. High in nitrogen and phosphorus.
fertilizers.benefits: Encourages vigorous growth and flowering.
fertilizers.usage: Mix into soil before planting or as a side dressing.
fertilizers.tips: Use in moderation to avoid nutrient burn.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Store in a dry place.

fertilizers.name: Plant-Based Fertilizer
fertilizers.description: Fertilizer made from plant materials. Provides a balanced nutrient profile.
fertilizers.benefits: Eco-friendly option for improving soil health.
fertilizers.usage: Apply as needed throughout the growing season.
fertilizers.tips: Combine with other amendments for best results.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Keep in a dry, cool place.

fertilizers.name: Granular Organic Fertilizer
fertilizers.description: Slow-release fertilizer made from organic materials. Provides nutrients over time.
fertilizers.benefits: Supports long-term plant health and growth.
fertilizers.usage: Apply as directed, usually every 6-8 weeks.
fertilizers.tips: Water well after application.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Store in a dry place to prevent clumping.

fertilizers.name: High-Phosphorus Fertilizer
fertilizers.description: Fertilizer designed to boost flowering and fruiting. High in phosphorus.
fertilizers.benefits: Encourages strong blooms and healthy fruit development.
fertilizers.usage: Apply during the flowering stage of plants.
fertilizers.tips: Do not over-apply; follow instructions carefully.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Store in a cool, dry place.

fertilizers.name: Liquid Fertilizer
fertilizers.description: Water-soluble fertilizer for quick nutrient absorption. Easy to use for container plants.
fertilizers.benefits: Provides immediate nutrients for rapid growth.
fertilizers.usage: Dilute with water and apply every 2-4 weeks.
fertilizers.tips: Monitor plants closely after application.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Store in a cool, dark place.

fertilizers.name: Nettle Fertilizer
fertilizers.description: Organic fertilizer made from nettle plants. Rich in nitrogen and beneficial for leafy greens.
fertilizers.benefits: Promotes healthy leaf growth and pest resistance.
fertilizers.usage: Dilute and use as a foliar spray or soil drench.
fertilizers.tips: Use gloves when handling nettle.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Store in a cool, dark place.

fertilizers.name: Citrus Fertilizer
fertilizers.description: Specially formulated fertilizer for citrus plants. High in potassium and magnesium.
fertilizers.benefits: Enhances fruit production and flavor.
fertilizers.usage: Apply every 4-6 weeks during the growing season.
fertilizers.tips: Water well after application.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Store in a dry place.

fertilizers.name: Dried Blood Fertilizer
fertilizers.description: Organic fertilizer made from dried animal blood. High in nitrogen.
fertilizers.benefits: Promotes rapid plant growth and greening.
fertilizers.usage: Mix into soil or use as a top dressing.
fertilizers.tips: Use gloves when handling.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Keep away from pets.

fertilizers.name: Compost Starter
fertilizers.description: Accelerates composting process by adding beneficial microorganisms.
fertilizers.benefits: Helps create nutrient-rich compost quickly.
fertilizers.usage: Add to compost pile when starting a new batch.
fertilizers.tips: Maintain moisture in compost pile.
fertilizers.careInstructions: Store in a cool, dry place.
